Quick search

readmirhead¶

This module contains functionality for reading header information from miriad files.

Reference¶

apercal.subs.readmirhead.fixra(ra0)[source]¶

fixra: module to fix the notation of the ra string ra0: input ra notation from a skycoords query returns: the fixed notation for the ra

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getbeamimage(infile)[source]¶

Uses the three functions above to return the beam parameters of an image (bmaj, bmin, bpa) infile (string): input image file in MIRIAD format returns (numpyarray): The bmaj, bmin, bpa of the image

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getbmajimage(infile)[source]¶

getbmajimage: Get the major beam size from a MIRIAD image infile (string): input image file in MIRIAD format returns (float): BMAJ in arcseconds of the image

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getbminimage(infile)[source]¶

getbminimage: Get the minor beam size from a MIRIAD image infile (string): input image file in MIRIAD format returns (float): BMIN in arcseconds of the image

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getbpaimage(infile)[source]¶

getbmpaimage: Get the beam angle from a MIRIAD image infile (string): input image file in MIRIAD format returns (float): BPA in degrees of the image

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getdecimage(infile)[source]¶

getdecimage: Get the DEC from a MIRIAD image infile (string): input image file in MIRIAD format returns: DEC coordinates dd:mm:ss.sss

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getfreq(infile)[source]¶

getfreq: module to extract the central freqeuncy of the observing band param infile: infile (name of file) returns: the central frequency of the visibility file

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getnchan(infile)[source]¶

getnchan: module to extract the number of channels from an observation param infile: infile (name of file) return: the number of channels of the observation

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getradec(infile)[source]¶

getradec: module to extract the pointing centre ra and dec from a miriad image file. Uses the PRTHD task in miriad inputs: infile (name of file) returns: coords, an instance of the astropy.coordinates SkyCoord class which has a few convenient attributes.

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getradecsex(infile)[source]¶

skycoords: The astropy SkyCoord instance values to covert to a string returns: String with the RA and DEC in format hh:mm:ss,dd:mm:ss

apercal.subs.readmirhead.getraimage(infile)[source]¶

getraimage: Get the RA cooridinate from a miriad image infile (string): input image file in MIRIAD format returns: RA coordinates of the image in hh:mm:ss.sss
